title: How to Make Maple French Toast Muffins

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients for the French toast topping together in a medium bowl.
Prepare a medium bowl with the cup of milk, melted butter, maple flavoring, and egg.
Combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
Add the milk mixture into the flour mixture.
Pour the batter into each of the muffin tin cups.
steps.description: Spray the tin with canola oil if you wish.

steps.headline: Layer a small amount of the French Toast topping on top of each cup.
steps.description: Press it down slightly in the mixture.

steps.headline: Brush the hot muffins with maple syrup.
steps.description: Make cinnamon sugar and sprinkle it over the muffins.

steps.headline: Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing.

text: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).  Mix the ingredients for the French toast topping together in a medium bowl. Place on the side. Prepare a medium bowl with the cup of milk, melted butter, maple flavoring, and egg.  Combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.  Add the milk mixture into the flour mixture. Mix thoroughly. Pour the batter into each of the muffin tin cups. Spray the tin with canola oil if you wish. Layer a small amount of the French Toast topping on top of each cup. Press it down slightly in the mixture. Place it in the oven. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Brush the hot muffins with maple syrup. Make cinnamon sugar and sprinkle it over the muffins. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing.  Serve warm and enjoy.
